metadata.name: The Tarantula
metadata.description:
Description

Jewel from the southern skies, the Tarantula nebula is part of the Large Magellanic Cloud and is a very bright active region of the sky where lots of stars are born and is only visible from the southern hemisphere.  
It has a total radius of 931 light years is about 159,800 light years from earth and is located in the constellation of Dorado.

It is an extremely luminous object, so bright in fact that if it was as close to earth of the famous Orion nebula, it would cast visible shadows. It is actually the most active starburst region in the local group galaxies we know off.

This image was captured in Melbourne using Hydrogen Alpha, Oxygen iii and Sulfur ii filters for the nebula and RGB filters for the stars and consist of a total 24h of exposures.

General Information:

Photographer: Steeve Body 
Full Resolution: 3420 × 4610 jpeg 
1/1 edition 
Image credit: Steeve Body  

Coordinates:

RA center: 05h40m51s.72 
DEC center: -69°20′34″.10 
Pixel scale: 1.05 arcsec/pixel 
Orientation: -70.142 degrees Field radius: 0.834 degrees

Equipment:

Imaging Telescopes: Askar 107PHQ  
Imaging Cameras: ZWO ASI1600MM Pro  
Mounts: Sky-Watcher EQ6-R Pro  
Filters: Antlia 3nm Narrowband H-alpha 1.25" · Antlia 3nm Narrowband Oxygen III 1.25" · Antlia 3nm Narrowband Sulfur II 1.25" · Antlia Blue Pro · Antlia Green Pro · Antlia Red Pro  
Accessories: Intel NUC 8 · Pegasus Astro Falcon Rotator · Pegasus Astro Powerbox Micro · Pegasus Astro Scops OAG · ZWO EAF

Frames:

Antlia 3nm Narrowband H-alpha 1.25": 45×600″(7h 30′) (gain: 139.00) -10°C bin 1×1  
Antlia 3nm Narrowband Oxygen III 1.25": 45×600″(7h 30′) (gain: 139.00) -10°C bin 1×1  
Antlia 3nm Narrowband Sulfur II 1.25": 45×600″(7h 30′) (gain: 139.00) -10°C  
Antlia Blue Pro: 40×45″(30′) (gain: 0.00) -10°C bin 1×1  
Antlia Green Pro: 40×45″(30′) (gain: 0.00) -10°C bin 1×1  
Antlia Red Pro: 40×45″(30′) (gain: 0.00) -10°C bin 1×1

Integration:  
24h

Location:  
Bentleigh, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Date: Oct 3rd 2022
